author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: Fox News host Will Cain is the latest media figure on the right to be disappointed by a Trump administration memo debunking several widely circulated conspiracy theories about the disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein. “I’m looking at this memo. It says there’s no client list. Well, I don’t know what that means,” Cain said. “There’s no…
title: Fox News host rails against DOJ memo on Epstein

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: The Department of Veterans Affairs has abandoned plans to cut more than 80,000 employees, scaling back that number to just under 30,000 after a massive outcry from veterans, advocate groups and lawmakers and an exodus of individuals from the agency. In a Monday news release, the VA said that it was on pace to reduce…
title: Veterans Affairs dramatically scales back layoffs to less than half of initial plan

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: Right-wing influencers who have long promoted conspiracy theories about convicted sex trafficker Jeffrey Epstein are turning their ire on the Trump administration over a new Department of Justice memo seeking to debunk those theories. The memo released Monday said there was no evidence Epstein kept a “client list,” nor that he sought to blackmail powerful…
title: MAGA influencers fume over DOJ’s Epstein memo

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: President Trump signed his sweeping tax cut and spending package known as the “big, beautiful bill” into law during a Fourth of July celebration on Friday. The measure boosts defense and border wall funding and makes Trump’s 2017 tax cuts permanent, offsetting some of those costs with deep cuts to Medicaid, food assistance programs, student…
title: When will key aspects of Trump’s ‘big, beautiful bill’ take effect?

author: Saul Elbein
description: AUSTIN, Texas — Local, state and federal officials are all pointing fingers in the wake of the deadly Texas flooding, but one thing is certain: The warnings weren’t heard by the people who needed them. After the catastrophic Independence Day floods that killed at least 90 across Central Texas, state and county officials told reporters…
title: Deadly Texas floods leave officials pointing fingers after warnings missed

author: Al Weaver
description: The weekend’s fatal floods in Texas have sparked immediate clashes in Congress over the federal government’s role in preventing, or at least minimizing, the human toll of natural disasters.  On one side are Democrats pointing to the Trump administration’s cuts to the National Weather Service (NWS) as a potential reason the flood victims were not…
title: Fatal floods in Texas draw howls from Dems over Trump cuts

author: Joseph Choi
description: A group of medical organizations is suing Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and other health leaders in the Trump administration over the decision to stop recommending COVID-19 vaccines to healthy children and pregnant women. The lawsuit was filed in Massachusetts and alleges the removal of healthy children and pregnant women…
title: Medical organizations sue RFK Jr., HHS over vaccine policies

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: Founding member of OneRepublic, Tim Myers is pivoting from his bid for Congress to run for California's Lieutenant Governor instead, joining a crowded field of Democrats in the race.
title: OneRepublic founding member unveils bid for California lieutenant governor

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Former Russian Transport Minister Roman Starovoit was found dead in his car Monday, hours after Russian President Vladimir Putin dismissed him from his post, according to local officials. Svetlana Petrenko, a spokesperson for Russia’s State Investigative Committee, said the former minister’s body was found in his personal car with a gunshot wound and that the…
title: Russian minister dies hours after being sacked by Putin

author: Sharon Udasin
description: Declining snow accumulation in the mountains of the Northeastern U.S. will likely reduce the ability of forests to act as a carbon sink, a study has found. The shrinking snowpack and destructive freeze-thaw cycles now common in winter are damaging roots and decreasing rates of nutrient and carbon uptake, according to the study, published Monday…
title: Plunging snowpack levels may be curbing carbon storage capabilities of trees: Study

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Planned Parenthood sued the Trump administration on Monday over a provision in the new tax and spending law that would strip Medicaid funding from its health centers because the organization also provides abortions.  Planned Parenthood said the law unconstitutionally eliminates patients’ ability to use Medicaid as their insurance at any of its health centers nationwide.  “The…
title: Planned Parenthood sues over Trump megabill ‘defunding’ provision

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: A federal judge on Monday scrutinized the Trump administration’s plan for Kilmar Abrego Garcia if he’s released from criminal custody as soon as next week, ordering the government to produce a witness to answer more questions.  “It’s like trying to nail Jell-O to a wall trying to figure out what’s going to happen next week,” U.S. District Judge Paula Xinis…
title: Judge demands DOJ explain Abrego Garcia plans: ‘It’s like trying to nail Jell-O to a wall’

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Tech billionaire Elon Musk has launched the "America Party" to challenge the Republican/Democrat two-party system, while President Trump has dismissed the idea as a "train wreck."
title: What to know about Elon Musk’s ‘America Party’

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: Sen. Amy Klobuchar (D-Minn.) is criticizing Sen. Lisa Murkowski for the Alaska Republican’s decisive vote to advance the GOP’s “big, beautiful bill” last week. “I was very disappointed, putting it mildly,” Klobuchar told MSNBC host Jen Psaki.  Klobuchar also attacked a provision in the bill that will delay federal cuts to the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance…
title: Klobuchar ‘very disappointed’ in Murkowski over ‘big, beautiful bill’ support

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Former Democratic National Committee Chair Jaime Harrison suggested Sunday that President Trump’s tax and spending legislation will make red states more competitive in the next election cycle, as the consequences of the GOP megabill continue to take effect. In an interview on MSNBC’s “The Weekend” with Jonathan Capehart, Harrison pointed to the extension of the…
title: Former DNC chair: GOP megabill ‘only going to get worse for the American people’

author: Julia Mueller
description: The White House on Monday called it a “depraved lie” to blame President Trump for deadly flash floods in Texas, as some question whether Trump’s cuts to the federal government could have impacted the human toll of the disaster. “Unfortunately, in the wake of this once-in-a-generation natural disaster, we have seen many falsehoods pushed by…
title: Leavitt says blaming Trump for Texas floods is ‘depraved lie’

author: Robbie Soave, opinion contributor
description: I don't blame Mamdani for doing this.
title: Black New Yorkers slam Zohran Mamdani over race claims on his college application

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Texas Sen. Ted Cruz (R) said “something went wrong” when the staff at the all-girls Christian summer camp in Kerr County wasn’t warned of rising flood waters on the Guadalupe River, which killed at least 27 campers and counselors. “The fact that you have girls asleep in their cabins when the flood waters are rising,…
title: Cruz: ‘Something went wrong’ when camp wasn’t warned of flood

author: Tara Suter
description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries (D-N.Y.) said Monday he is planning to meet with Democratic New York City mayoral nominee Zohran Mamdani next week. “I’m scheduled to meet with him next week and we’ll have a conversation about his vision. He did run a campaign that was actually focused largely on affordability, and that was…
title: Jeffries plans to meet with Mamdani next week

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Catastrophic flooding in Texas Hill Country resulted in the deaths of at least 82 people, including 27 children and counselors from Camp Mystic, and dozens more are missing as search and rescue efforts continue, with questions remaining about the effectiveness of the warning system and staffing of federal offices.
title: What to know about deadly Texas flash flooding

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: A man was killed Monday after he opened fire at a U.S. Border Patrol facility in McAllen, Texas, police officials said. McAllen Police Chief Victor Rodriguez told reporters that federal agents responded to the shooting by returning fire at Ryan Louis Mosqueda, 27, who died. He had an assault rifle and was carrying a utility…
title: Man killed after opening fire at Border Patrol facility in Texas

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: The United States has broken its record for the highest number of measles cases in the country since the disease was eliminated in 2000.  It comes amid falling childhood vaccination rates and a rise in anti-vaccine sentiment fueled by lingering COVID-era distrust in public health authorities and a strengthening anti-vaccine movement.  Just halfway through the…
title: US measles cases surge to highest since disease was ‘eliminated’

author: John Mac Ghlionn, opinion contributor
description: The US fertility rate has declined to 1.6 children per woman, threatening the future of the nation, and a pronatalist revolution is needed to reverse this decline, with policies such as a 100 percent tax exemption for parents, guaranteed mortgages for families with two or more children, national service incentives, paid leave and education that reminds students why marriage and family matter.
title: A radical plan to make children a national priority

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) announced Monday that it would rescind protections from deportation for Nicaragua and Honduras. The move ends temporary protected status (TPS) for citizens of those countries living in the U.S., which were both established after the same deadly hurricane and in place for more than 25 years. The move will end protections from…
title: Trump administration ends protections from deportation for Honduras, Nicaragua

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump announced Monday his administration would impose a 25 percent tariff on imports from South Korea and Japan beginning Aug. 1 as part of a batch of letters going out to foreign countries. Trump detailed the expected tariff rates in letters to the leaders of Japan and South Korea, also posting them to Truth…
title: Trump announces 25 percent tariffs coming for Japan, South Korea

author: Ella Lee
description: The Trump administration’s crackdown on pro-Palestinian campus activists was put on trial Monday, as a federal judge in Boston weighs whether the government’s campaign is unlawful. It marks the first major trial of President Trump’s second administration, taking aim at a policy that has led to arrests and efforts to deport foreign-born students and faculty…
title: Trump administration’s pro-Palestinian campus activist crackdown put on trial

author: Richard Ghazal, opinion contributor
description: The United States must press the Syrian Transitional Government to bring the perpetrators of the Saint Elias Church attack to justice, implement robust security measures to protect Christian communities, and condition any formal diplomatic recognition on the Syrian Transitional Government's guarantee to protect minority rights, religious freedom and enshrine constitutional safeguards.
title: The vanishing Christians of Syria: A crisis the world cannot ignore

author: Jared Gans
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams said Andrew Cuomo asked him to drop his independent bid for reelection as the former New York governor considers whether to continue with his own candidacy.  Adams said during an interview Monday on CNBC that Cuomo “knew he was setting us up for this,” knowing that the incumbent mayor…
title: Adams says Cuomo asked him to drop out of NYC mayor’s race

description: White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt is scheduled to brief reporters early Monday afternoon. The briefing comes as the death toll from flash flooding in Texas over the holiday weekend rises. At least 89 people have been killed and an unknown number of people are missing. And earlier Monday, the Trump administration laid out a…
title: Watch live: White House news briefing

author: Sharon Udasin
description: Wild honeybees in Southern California are devouring the food supplies of native pollinators — posing a potential threat to the region’s natural ecosystems, a new study has found. These feral insects, which have greatly proliferated in Southern California, remove about 80 percent of pollen during the first day a flower opens, according to the study,…
title: Feral honeybees are threatening other Southern Californian pollinators: Study

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent late Sunday fired back at Larry Summers for the former Treasury secretary’s criticism of President Trump’s massive tax and spending legislation. In a thread on social platform X, Bessent demanded an apology from Summers for comparing the deaths that some estimates predict will result from the health care cuts in the…
title: Bessent demands apology from Summers over ‘big, beautiful bill’ criticism

author: Jim Townsend, opinion contributor
description: Members of Congress are carrying on the tradition of "oversight by showing up" to inspect Immigration and Customs Enforcement facilities, and the Trump administration should abandon its attempts to block these efforts and embrace the bipartisan tradition of congressional site visits that helped to win World War II.
title: Members of Congress visiting ICE facilities are showing up for democracy

author: Steph Whiteside
description: The area has already been hit by catastrophic flooding that has killed more than 80 people.
title: New flood alert issued in central Texas for already flooded areas

author: Laura Kelly
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio will travel to Malaysia July 8-12 for meetings of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN), marking his first trip to Asia as a State official. Rubio will seek to highlight U.S. commitment to the region, as relations have been strained by President Trump’s “reciprocal” tariff threats. The administration has…
title: Rubio headed to Malaysia in first Asia trip

author: Brianna Hollis
description: While local, state and federal assets are in place across central Texas in the aftermath of Friday's deadly floods, volunteers are also helping out through efforts coordinated through first responders.
title: ‘It’s sobering’: Volunteers search debris for bodies after Texas flooding

author: Alexander J. Motyl, opinion contributor
description: Vladimir Putin recently admitted that Russia is an artificial construct created by violence.
title: Putin’s talk of soldiers’ feet puts the lie to Russian nationalist myths

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear is considering a 2028 presidential run because he is concerned about the future of the country, while criticizing the recently passed "One Big Beautiful Bill Act" for its devastating impact on rural health care and adding trillions of dollars to the national debt.
title: Beshear on possible 2028 run: ‘I do not want to leave a broken country’ to future generations

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: CNN anchor Pamela Brown reminisced Sunday about her time attending the summer camp where 27 campers and counselors died as a result of intense flooding over the weekend. “It’s surreal coming back here,” Brown said while reporting from the site of the tragedy, calling it a “magical place” and recalling the “anticipation” she and other…
title: CNN anchor reminisces about Camp Mystic while reporting on Texas floods

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Biden's senior advisors urged him to participate in the debate against Trump, which ultimately led to his withdrawal from the race and the nomination of Kamala Harris as the Democratic candidate.
title: Biden aides pushed for early debate with Trump: Memo

author: Chris Truax, opinion contributor
description: Constitutional rights have to be enforceable. They can’t rely on the goodwill of the government. This utter lack of accountability is a charter for abuse. And that abuse is happening right now.
title: In the Supreme Court’s battle over nationwide injunctions, no one wins

author: Julia Shapero
description: Tesla’s stock tumbled 7 percent Monday morning after Elon Musk launched a third party and received an icy response from President Trump.  The tech billionaire announced Saturday he officially formed the America Party, a third party meant to challenge Republicans and Democrats, after weeks of floating the idea amid a feud with the president.  Musk…
title: Tesla stock tumbles after Musk launches third party

author: Tara Suter
description: Rep. Joaquin Castro (D-Texas) said Sunday that the possible role of National Weather Service (NWS) staffing cuts in recent Texas flooding deaths should be investigated.  “Two Texas National Weather Service offices involved in forecasting and warning about flooding on the Guadalupe River are missing some key staff members,” CNN’s Dana Bash said on “State of…
title: Texas Democrat: Possible role of NWS staffing cuts in flooding deaths should be investigated

author: Juan Williams, opinion contributor
description: The high number of Trump supporters who rely on rural hospitals and health centers will specifically feel the impact.
title: Trump’s mega-bill will hurt the health of his own voters

author: Christopher Adams
description: At least 82 people have been killed in "catastrophic" flash flooding across Texas, while several others remain missing.
title: MAP: Where have flash flooding fatalities been confirmed in Texas?

author: Austin Sarat, opinion contributor
description: The courts shouldn’t allow Texas to restrict campus protests that it finds offensive or politically incorrect.
title: How Texas is wielding freedom of speech as a political weapon

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Camp Mystic in a statement posted on its website said 27 of its campers and counselors died in the catastrophic flooding in Kerr County, Texas, over the Fourth of July weekend. “Camp Mystic is grieving the loss of 27 campers and counselors following the catastrophic flooding on the Guadalupe river,” the camp said in the…
title: Camp Mystic says it is mourning loss of 27 campers, counselors in Texas flooding

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump is set to send out a first batch of letters Monday to other nations informing them of new tariff rates, but those tariffs won’t go into effect until Aug. 1, White House officials said. Trump has in recent days teased that his administration will begin informing countries of the tariff rate they will…
title: Trump officials unveil new, delayed deadline for tariffs

author: Dwayne Royster, opinion contributor
description: To every member of Congress: You are not helpless pawns. Your vote is not just a mark on paper — it is a measure of your soul.
title: Bad faith and betrayal in Trump’s ‘big beautiful bill’

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Tech billionaire Elon Musk trolled President Trump early Monday with a post knocking the administration for making no arrests related to the Jeffrey Epstein case. Musk, Trump’s former ally-turned-foe, posted an image to the social platform X of “The Official Jeffrey Epstein Pedophile Arrest Counter,” set to “0000.” “What’s the time? Oh look, it’s no-one-has-been-arrested-o’clock…
title: Musk tweaks Trump with Jeffrey Epstein post

author: The Associated Press
description: As of Sunday, at least 51 were confirmed dead as a result of flooding in Texas.
title: What we know about victims of devastating Texas floods

author: Peter Navarro, opinion contributor
description: By stubbornly refusing to lower rates, he is headed for this third major policy blunder in six year
title: Jerome Powell is competing to be the worst Fed chair in history

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: President Trump threatened to impose an additional 10 percent tariff on countries “aligning” themselves with the BRICS bloc of developing nations. “Any Country aligning themselves with the Anti-American policies of BRICS, will be charged an ADDITIONAL 10% Tariff. There will be no exceptions to this policy. Thank you for your attention to this matter!” Trump…
title: Trump threatens additional tariffs on nations ‘aligning’ with ‘anti-American’ BRICS
